p: The first clinically relevant mAb approved by the FDAÂ was orthoclone OKT3, an anti-CD3 antibody targeting T cells, in 1985, as a prophylaxis for organ transplant patients [ 112]. As the field evolved, the steady progression towards harnessing and arming the immune system to combat transformed cells intensified, leading to the discovery of rituximab, an anti-CD20 B-cell receptor antibody and the first successful mAb therapy approved for the treatment of hematological B-cell lymphoma [ 113].
